subject: Re: [junit] [PATCH] filter stack traces in junit
msgSnippet: ... How is new StackTraceElement[0] better or different from new StackTraceElement[] {} ? And since we re nitpicking... I prefer to set the size myself: return
messageBody:
On 2/10/06, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains@...> wrote:
>
> Ben Maurer wrote:
> <snip />
>
> I'm in a code-reviewing mood, so don't mind me. There are just
> suggestions.
>
> > + List<StackTraceElement> filtered = new
> > ArrayList<StackTraceElement> ();
> > + for (StackTraceElement ele : trace)
> > + filtered.add (ele);
>
> Why not just
>
> new ArrayList<StackTraceElement>(Arrays.asList(trace))
>
> here? (Add the necessary types to make that proper Java 5.0. I don't
> speak parameterized types.)
>
> > + return filtered.toArray (new StackTraceElement [] {});
>
> new StackTraceElement[0]


How is new StackTraceElement[0] better or different from new
StackTraceElement[] {} ?

And since we're nitpicking... I prefer to set the size myself:

return filtered.toArray (new StackTraceElement [filtered.size()]);

Otherwise, the List will allocate the array with a more expensive call (
Array.newInstance()).

--
Cédric


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
